nodes.name: MCP Client to Scrape as markdown

parameters.text:
=Scrape Plan name and pricing from the url below
url: {{ $('üõ†Ô∏è Set Search Parameters').item.json.url }}

parameters.content:
## üß© **SECTION 1: Setup & Historical Data Fetch**

### üîÅ 1. **Trigger: Check Job Listings**

üïí **(Schedule Node)**
This starts the automation on a regular interval ‚Äî daily, weekly, etc.

**Use Case**: Ensures your workflow is constantly monitoring the latest ClickUp pricing updates without manual effort.

---

### üõ†Ô∏è 2. **Set Search Parameters**

‚úèÔ∏è **(Set Node)**
Defines static inputs like the page URL, service name ("ClickUp"), or brand being tracked. These parameters tell the agent what exactly to look for.

**Use Case**: You can reuse this automation for other tools (Notion, Airtable, etc.) by just updating these search values.

---

### üìÑ 3. **Retrieve Pricing Data**

üìó **(Google Sheet Read Node)**
This fetches the last known pricing saved in your Google Sheet, acting as the reference to detect future changes.

**Use Case**: Maintains a historical record to compare against the freshly scraped data.

---

## ü§ñ **SECTION 2: AI Agent Scrapes Pricing**

### ü§ñ 4. **AI Agent**

üí° **(Agent Node Powered by OpenAI)**
The heart of the workflow. It does the intelligent part:

* Uses Bright Data‚Äôs **MCP proxy** to bypass bot protections
* Scrapes ClickUp‚Äôs pricing page
* Parses it into structured plans using markdown + structured output

**Sub-Nodes**:

* üîó **MCP Client to Scrape as Markdown** ‚Äì fetches page source via mobile proxy
* üß† **LLM Brain (OpenAI)** ‚Äì interprets content and extracts clean pricing details
* üßÆ **Structured Output Parser** ‚Äì formats data into structured JSON like:

  ```json
  { "plan_name": "Business", "price": "$12", "key_features": [...] }
  ```

**Use Case**: No scraping code required. AI handles extraction even if layout or structure changes slightly on the competitor website.

---

## üîÑ **SECTION 3: Compare, Decide & Update**

### üß≠ 5. **If Price Changes**

‚öñÔ∏è **(IF Node)**
Smart comparison logic:

* Compares scraped price with saved price
* If they **match**, nothing happens
* If they **differ**, it triggers an update

**Use Case**: Prevents unnecessary writes or noise. Only acts when something truly changed.

---

### ‚ùå 6. **No Operation, Do Nothing**

üõë **(Empty Node)**
This is the false branch of the IF check. If prices are the same, this path confirms that no update is needed.

---

### üì§ 7. **Update Google Sheet**

üìó **(Google Sheet Write Node)**
If there's a price change, this node updates your record with the new pricing info.

**Use Case**: Keeps your competitor tracking spreadsheet always up-to-date ‚Äî automatically.

---

## üöÄ **Track ClickUp Pricing Changes Automatically**

A no-code automation using **n8n**, **Bright Data MCP**, and **Google Sheets** to monitor pricing changes on ClickUp and update the record only when something changes.

---

## üß© **SECTION 1: Setup & Historical Data Fetch**

### üîÅ 1. **Trigger: Check Job Listings**

üïí **(Schedule Node)**
This starts the automation on a regular interval ‚Äî daily, weekly, etc.

**Use Case**: Ensures your workflow is constantly monitoring the latest ClickUp pricing updates without manual effort.

---

### üõ†Ô∏è 2. **Set Search Parameters**

‚úèÔ∏è **(Set Node)**
Defines static inputs like the page URL, service name ("ClickUp"), or brand being tracked. These parameters tell the agent what exactly to look for.

**Use Case**: You can reuse this automation for other tools (Notion, Airtable, etc.) by just updating these search values.

---

### üìÑ 3. **Retrieve Pricing Data**

üìó **(Google Sheet Read Node)**
This fetches the last known pricing saved in your Google Sheet, acting as the reference to detect future changes.

**Use Case**: Maintains a historical record to compare against the freshly scraped data.

---

## ü§ñ **SECTION 2: AI Agent Scrapes Pricing**

### ü§ñ 4. **AI Agent**

üí° **(Agent Node Powered by OpenAI)**
The heart of the workflow. It does the intelligent part:

* Uses Bright Data‚Äôs **MCP proxy** to bypass bot protections
* Scrapes ClickUp‚Äôs pricing page
* Parses it into structured plans using markdown + structured output

**Sub-Nodes**:

* üîó **MCP Client to Scrape as Markdown** ‚Äì fetches page source via mobile proxy
* üß† **LLM Brain (OpenAI)** ‚Äì interprets content and extracts clean pricing details
* üßÆ **Structured Output Parser** ‚Äì formats data into structured JSON like:

  ```json
  { "plan_name": "Business", "price": "$12", "key_features": [...] }
  ```

**Use Case**: No scraping code required. AI handles extraction even if layout or structure changes slightly on the competitor website.

---

## üîÑ **SECTION 3: Compare, Decide & Update**

### üß≠ 5. **If Price Changes**

‚öñÔ∏è **(IF Node)**
Smart comparison logic:

* Compares scraped price with saved price
* If they **match**, nothing happens
* If they **differ**, it triggers an update

**Use Case**: Prevents unnecessary writes or noise. Only acts when something truly changed.

---

### ‚ùå 6. **No Operation, Do Nothing**

üõë **(Empty Node)**
This is the false branch of the IF check. If prices are the same, this path confirms that no update is needed.

---

### üì§ 7. **Update Google Sheet**

üìó **(Google Sheet Write Node)**
If there's a price change, this node updates your record with the new pricing info.

**Use Case**: Keeps your competitor tracking spreadsheet always up-to-date ‚Äî automatically.

---

## üéØ **Benefits for Beginners**

| üß† **Smart**                            | üö´ **No Coding Needed**     | üîÑ **Always Updated**                         |
| --------------------------------------- | --------------------------- | --------------------------------------------- |
| Uses AI to extract complex pricing info | Every part is drag-and-drop | Keeps your database aligned with live pricing |

---

## ‚ú® **Visual Summary**

```
[‚è± Trigger] ‚ûù [‚úèÔ∏è Set Params] ‚ûù [üìÑ Fetch Old Prices]
        ‚¨á
     [ü§ñ Agent Scrapes with AI & Bright Data MCP]
        ‚¨á
[‚öñÔ∏è Compare Old vs New] ‚Üí false ‚Üí [üö´ Do Nothing]
                     ‚Ü≥ true ‚Üí [üìó Update Google Sheet]
```

---

## üß© Want to Extend This?

* üîî **Slack Alerts**: Notify your team when pricing changes
* üìä **Charts**: Build dashboards from historical pricing
* üì• **Auto-Save Snapshots**: Save HTML or screenshots for compliance
* üìå **Multiple Competitors**: Track Airtable, Notion, Monday.com by duplicating this setup

---
